result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen A Shands was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Serve 4 and 1/2 months in the House of Correction with Huber privileges for employment and school; credit for 4 days served.
-  Probation can be terminated/discharged by the probation agent after 9 months

miscConds.notes:
-  Court waives costs, fees, assessments and surcharges due to defendant's inability to pay.
-  Provide a DNA sample (if not already done so)
-  Pay the DNA surcharge during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  Full-time employment or part-time employment and school or full-time school
COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephen A Shands

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Bail refund
corrected JOC to read 4 and 1/2 months HOC or 4 months, 15 days.
DOC request to clarify length of imposed and stayed jail term.  Matter referred to clerk's office to correct clerical error in JOC.
3/30/16 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

16A 011069
Misdemeanor court costs were incorrectly applied and have been erased.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by the State, Defense counsel and defendant.

Court sentenced defendant to serve  4 and 1/2 months in the House of Correction with Huber privileges for employment and school; credit for  4  days served. 

Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for  12  MONTHS with the following conditions:
-  Probation can be terminated/discharged by the probation agent after 9 months
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  No illegal drugs
-  Full-time employment or part-time employment and school or full-time school
-  Court waives costs, fees, assessments and surcharges due to defendant's inability to pay.
-  Provide a DNA sample (if not already done so)
-  Pay the DNA surcharge during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Stephen A Shands in court with Attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY  and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Stephen A Shands in court with Attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case cannot proceed to plea and sentencing on today's date as court is in trial on an unrelated case.
Case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28.
Clerk:  jms

JusticePoint Pretrial Report dated February 16, 2016 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Parties are prepared to proceed to plea hearing on the amended charge.

During the plea colloquy defendant informed Court he was not feeling well, Court declines to proceed with the plea.
Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28.

Defendant Stephen A Shands in court with Attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State files Amended Information with the court:

Count 1:  Obstructing An Officer, a Class A misdemeanor, contrary to Wisconsin State Stats. 946.41(1), 939.51(3)(a)

Arraignment held.
Defense counsel waived reading of the Amended Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.
Clerk:  jms
Justice Point Report received and filed.

Defendant Stephen A Shands in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference conducted.  Defense still investigating case.  Matter adjourned for Status.

Parties are informed that effective December 14, 2015, this matter will be assigned to Br. 28, Judge Sanders, Room 629 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Stephen A Shands in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney requests additional time to review case.  Status conference scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed.

Attorney Leah R. Thomas in court, defendant Stephen A Shands not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference conducted.  Defense just received discovery and offer.  Matter adjourned for pretrial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Stephen A Shands in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant wants new counsel.  Motion to withdraw granted.  Matter set for Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed.

Defendant Stephen A Shands in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a Jury Trial.  Matter rescheduled for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed.

Defendant Stephen A Shands in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stay on bench warrant lifted and all previous conditions of bail to remain the same.  Parties may have reached a resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gregory A. Renden in court.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not appear.  Defense requests that the bench warrant be stayed to allow him time to contact his client.  Status conference scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Stephen A Shands in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 06-25-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Stephen A Shands in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:   City of Milwaukee Police Dept. Officer Marlin Schilcher.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 21 for scheduling conference.

05/30/2015
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Stephen A Shands in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Stephen A Shands in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BRASH, Branch 21.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
